entries.meaning: (set theory, order theory, of a binary relation R on a set S) Having the property that, for any two distinct elements of S, at least one is not related to the other via R; equivalently, having the property that, for any x, y ∈ S, if both xRy and yRx then x=y.
examples: The standard example for an antisymmetric relation is the relation less than or equal to on the real number system.
